info.name: Fx FindBar Tweak ext companion
info.description: A companion style for the FindBar Tweak extension for Fx25+. The style also works about the same if you don't use the extension: reduce the Mozilla-extreme height of the new findbar, move the close button back to the left side (where I'm used to looking for it), and add some color highlighting to the bar/buttons (to increase visibility). NOTE: Updates are pending--waiting for the new server here to settle down... should be soon.
info.additionalInfo: Besides adding a bunch of extra functionality to the find processing, the FindBar Tweak extension also fixes a bug or two related to the findbar. So, it's well worth using: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/findbar-tweak/ ____ BTW, if you're using an alternate position for the findbar (at the top, right or left) and a theme which sets the text to a white/light color, I've updated the style to work better with that configuration. ____ 24Nov2013 -- my reply [in part] to the review/comment ("Pink?") that got "eaten" by the site update/move: Not "pink", magenta--the same magenta used to "highlight all" by Firefox but lightened for a toolbar background to go with dark text; unlike magenta, pink has much more red than blue. No, I don't intend to change it in the posted style, but you can certainly edit your installed copy to change it to a color you like better with your theme. I might update the style in the near future to use install options for alternate background colors, but not for the moment--still working on whether I want to do the same for findbar height options. It's a work in progress. ____ About bar/button height... With default extension preferences and this style, the findbar is 22px in height (which I like, of course) instead of Mozilla's default 34px, which is 6px more than the previous findbar default of 27px. You can easily modify the style's code to make the bar and/or buttons just a little "taller" (if you find the new height to be too small for your liking) by increasing the top/bottom padding for each (the bar and/or buttons). The extension has an option to show only the icons instead of the labels for the buttons which will itself increase the height by 1px (primarily due to positioning of the icons as opposed to their size). The point is: you can make it look just about any way you want it to using a little CSS. ____ About colors... Highlighters--both the original felt-tip as well as the newer electronic varieties--work well due to using bright and/or garish colors. They make something more visible. I've tried to duplicate some of the highlighter colors here. The green is pulled directly from Firefox and the extension. So is the magenta except for being lightened up a bit since it's paired with black text instead of the usual white. The yellow is the original highlighter yellow--the standard, default color used by most highlighting processes. And the blue is fairly close the the second most popular felt-tip color after yellow. (If I could replace the "mannerly" white text on a grey background that Firefox still occasionally displays for find processing, I would; but that's beyond the scope of both this style and the extension.) If nothing else, you'll definitely see the text being found... not to mention the findbar itself. ;) (Frankly, all I really wanted was a findbar that wasn't so freakin' BIG!)
